snippet: Phil Hughes, who lost three of his four starts in April, had his best outing of 2012 but still gave up four runs in five and two-thirds innings.
abstract: Baltimore Orioles defeat New York Yankees, 7-1. Photos (M)1
lead_paragraph: The most revealing evidence of how bad this season has been for Phil Hughes came to light on a night when he was armed with his best stuff, facing a pitcher who had not won since last June and working against a team the Yankees usually beat with impunity. But even with all that working for him, Hughes still was not good enough to win. With the Yankees' offense listing for the second consecutive game, the Baltimore Orioles won, 7-1, on Tuesday night at Yankee Stadium for Buck Showalter's 1,000th victory as a big-league manager.

headline.main: It's a New Month but a Similar Struggle for Hughes
